alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 25 at 8:39PM PST until December 27 at 9:14PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Willapa Hills and South Washington Coast zones. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grays River near Rosburg. * WHEN...From late Monday night to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, expect some flooding of roads along and near the Grays River, including roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge over the Grays, and portions of Covered Bridge Road, Barr-Durrah Road, and Loop Road near Rosburg and Hwy 4. Above 14.0 feet, expect widespread lowland flooding and numerous flooded roads near Rosburg and Hwy 4. This includes the roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge over the Grays River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM PST Sunday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM PST.
